instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
threads.message:
was at other Lab, say there was water damage, cant see any spots or signs of water damage, just on the screen port(screen side--at the board side j8500 clean)
on charger 20V 0.6A, CPU getting hot (no 2 hot), fan spin but no keyboard activity not recognized on external screen and not enter to DFU.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_T_USB</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
threads.message:
did you mean L7210/20? and L7430?
L7210/20 - 1V
L7430/20/10 - 0V all full short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
threads.message:
Yes; sorry, I was looking to wrong schematic.

Don't be so sure about full short; these coils have very low resistance to ground as normal.
iGPU voltage will not appear until high load graphics is detected.

Another thing to note; no DFU, as this board doesn't have T2 chip.

L7210/20 voltage should drop to aprox 0.6V when board really boots.
Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 86264, member: 682"]
L7210/20 voltage should drop to aprox 0.6V when board really boots.
[/QUOTE]
it stuck on 1v
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 86264, member: 682"]
Did you try known good BIOS?
[/QUOTE]
yes i was write new ROM from working board with Medusa but the same.. also no USB activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "water damage" "dead"
threads.message: Probably damaged CPU because of liquid spill on video output.
